00040 #ifndef __CVMX_THUNDER_H__
00041 #define __CVMX_THUNDER_H__
00042 
00043 /**
00044  * @file
00045  *
00046  * Interface to the Thunder specific devices
00047  *
00048  * <hr>$Revision: 73845 $<hr>
00049  *
00050  */
00051 
00052 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00053 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00054 extern "C" {
00055 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00056 #endif
00057 
00058 #define CVMX_RTC_DS1374_ADDR   (0x68)
00059 
00060 /*
00061  * Read time-of-day counter.
00062  * This function is called internally by cvmx-rtc functions.
00063  */
00064 uint32_t cvmx_rtc_ds1374_read(void);
00065 
00066 /*
00067  * Write time-of-day counter.
00068  * This function is called internally by cvmx-rtc functions.
00069  */
00070 int cvmx_rtc_ds1374_write(uint32_t time);
00071 
00072 /**
00073  * LAN bypass modes.
00074  */
00075 typedef enum {
00076     CVMX_LAN_BYPASS_OFF = 0,
00077                    /**< LAN bypass is disabled, port 0 and port 1
00078                                     are always connected to Octeon */
00079     CVMX_LAN_BYPASS_GPIO,
00080                    /**< LAN bypass controlled by GPIO only */
00081     CVMX_LAN_BYPASS_WATCHDOG,
00082                    /**< LAN bypass controlled by watchdog (and GPIO) */
00083     CVMX_LAN_BYPASS_LAST    /* Keep as last entry */
00084 } cvmx_lan_bypass_mode_t;
00085 
00086 /**
00087  * Set LAN bypass mode.
00088  *
00089  * Supported modes are:
00090  * - CVMX_LAN_BYPASS_OFF
00091  *     <br>LAN ports are connected ( port 0 <--> Octeon <--> port 1 )
00092  *
00093  * - CVMX_LAN_BYPASS_GPIO
00094  *     <br>LAN bypass is controlled by software using cvmx_lan_bypass_force() function.
00095  *     When transitioning to this mode, default is LAN bypass enabled
00096  *     ( port 0 <--> port 1, disconnected from Octeon ).
00097  *
00098  * - CVMX_LAN_BYPASS_WATCHDOG
00099  *     <br>LAN bypass is inactive as long as the watchdog is kept alive.
00100  *     The default expiration time is 1 second and the function to
00101  *     call periodically to prevent watchdog expiration is
00102  *     cvmx_lan_bypass_keep_alive().
00103  *
00104  * @param mode           LAN bypass mode
00105  *
00106  * @return Error code, or 0 in case of success
00107  */
00108 int cvmx_lan_bypass_mode_set(cvmx_lan_bypass_mode_t mode);
00109 
00110 /**
00111  * Return status of LAN bypass circuit.
00112  *
00113  * @return 1 if ports are in LAN bypass, or 0 if normally connected
00114  */
00115 int cvmx_lan_bypass_is_active(void);
00116 
00117 /**
00118  * Refresh watchdog timer.
00119  *
00120  * Call periodically (less than 1 second) to prevent triggering LAN bypass.
00121  * The alternative cvmx_lan_bypass_keep_alive_ms() is provided for cases
00122  * where a variable interval is required.
00123  */
00124 void cvmx_lan_bypass_keep_alive(void);
00125 
00126 /**
00127  * Refresh watchdog timer, setting a specific expiration interval.
00128  *
00129  * @param interval_ms     Interval, in milliseconds, to next watchdog expiration.
00130  */
00131 void cvmx_lan_bypass_keep_alive_ms(uint32_t interval_ms);
00132 
00133 /**
00134  * Control LAN bypass via software.
00135  *
00136  * @param force_bypass   Force LAN bypass to active (1) or inactive (0)
00137  *
00138  * @return Error code, or 0 in case of success
00139  */
00140 int cvmx_lan_bypass_force(int force_bypass);
00141 
00142 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00143 /* *INDENT-OFF* */
00144 }
00145 /* *INDENT-ON* */
00146 #endif
00147 #endif /* __CVMX_THUNDER_H__ */
